title: Geth sync stuck - ropsten network
body:
Geth version: v.1.10.20
OS & Version: Debian 11
Network: Ropsten

Tried on 3 different servers using version (v.1.10.19 & v.1.10.20) to finish sync for ropsten network.
I have deleted blockchaindata and started fresh sync with `fast` and `snap` mode, however sync is still stuck random on some block number and won't update anymore blocks. This is happening for ~ 2 weeks i tought it will finish sync of headers and will be done but in the end sync is still in progress but not updating blocks.


```
------------ GETH SYNCING PROGRESS
progress: 99.50171490187371 %
blocks left to parse: 61849
current Block: 12350523 of 12412372
block Number: 0

> eth.syncing
{
  currentBlock: 12350523,
  healedBytecodeBytes: 1250670,
  healedBytecodes: 167,
  healedTrienodeBytes: 143317108986,
  healedTrienodes: 269462599,
  healingBytecode: 0,
  healingTrienodes: 1108,
  highestBlock: 12412389,
  startingBlock: 12350523,
  syncedAccountBytes: 9731627058,
  syncedAccounts: 331404608,
  syncedBytecodeBytes: 10681534770,
  syncedBytecodes: 1897555,
  syncedStorage: 229412261,
  syncedStorageBytes: 51645033221
}
> net.peerCount
6
> eth.blockNumber
0
```
Ropsten was switched over to it's own beacon chain. You need to run a beacon client along side Geth. https://blog.ethereum.org/2022/05/30/ropsten-merge-announcement/

Hmm, though that seems to not yet be the merge block. Still, please make sure you have a beacon client set up correctly. At some block it needs to take over directing the chain head and Geth can only operate based on that info.

However, you are close enough to the transition point: https://ropsten.etherscan.io/block/12350713, probably snap sync is jumping back and forth when hitting the transition block and denying going forward. The Geth logs will probably show some warnings, complaining that you need the beacon client.

@karalabe  So far didn't find anything in logs about it. However i am setting up beacon client right now along with geth.

Ah, I see it. 1.10.20 is broken on the transition block :/ So you need to use 1.10.19 (or master branch) on Ropsten. I'll try to get a release out to get this fixed.
Still, you *do* need that beacon client even with the correct Geth version.

Mind you, syncing a beacon client from genesis is *very slow* (many hours even with an empty new chain) so you should probably start from a "weak subjectivity checkpoint" (i.e. point it at some other beacon client that's already synced). I'm not sure if Infura has an endpoint for Ropsten, but there's probably something somewhere out there than can get you faster up to date on a testnet.
